result.execSummary:
The defendant Lauren K Lusty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all court costs, supervision fees and any costs of treatment as a condition of probation.
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Attorney fees reimbursable back to Ozaukee County.

Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
counseling, AODA, health appointments, medicaid hearing
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.

Defendant to submit to random testing
Counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
Submit DNA sample

superMiscConds.notes:
Follow all treatment recommendations of the agent.
Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Pay supervision fees.
No contact with ex-husband unless arranged/approved by Dept of Corrections.

Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Court further orders 50% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant Lauren K Lusty in court with attorney Michael Girard Penkwitz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advised the defendant pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, that as a convicted felon she/he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also she/he may not vote in any election until their civil rights have been restored.
